moves.3. Bb5: My classic move. It works great!
moves.3... a6: The pawn mistake! Defend the pawn at e5!
moves.5... Qd4: I had never seen this move before. It's a good counterattack.
moves.6. f4: I attempt to defend the knight
moves.6... Qxe4+: ahh.....a good move here. This pawn evens things out.
moves.7. Qe2: I decide to use my queen to guard the king
moves.7... Qxe2+: I was afraid of this. I don't like playing without my queen.
moves.8... Nf6: I don't know why he did this. Development I think.
moves.9. Kd1: I want to move the rook to get his king in check.
moves.9... Bd6: He decides to destroy the knight.
moves.10. Nd3: I will have nothing of it.
moves.10... Bg4+: I think he knew my rook idea.
moves.11. Ke1: This way, he prevents the rook from getting out.
moves.11... O-O-O: And now he castles, guaranteeing his king's safety.
moves.12. h3: I try to scare of his bishop.
moves.12... Rhe8+: He uses my plan against me.
moves.13. Kf2: I decide to take the king north.
moves.13... Ne4+: He wants something, I'm sure of it!
moves.14... Bf5: I think he wants that knight.
moves.16... Bd5: You can tell what he wants, can't you?
moves.17. Nc3: A bad move by me. Getting the knight out of the way is a bad idea.
moves.18... Bc5+: He decides to wait a bit.
moves.21... Be4: He never did like that knight.
moves.22. Nxc5: I was so proud of myself untill.....
moves.24. Re1: I decide to take a huge risk.
moves.26... Kd7: He slowly brings his king down.....
moves.29. c4: I decide to try to put the king in check.
moves.30. b5: But, I have a battle to fight!
moves.31... Kd4: He decides to ignore my pawn..
moves.34. Kd1: I decide to run for it.
moves.34... a5: Kind of a pointless move I'm afraid. I wasn't planning to move that pawn anytime soon.
moves.35. Ke1: Why did I do this? A HORRIBLE MOVE!
moves.35... Rh1#: and he takes advantage. This was a very fun game to play. I made a few mistakes, but learned a thing or two also. GG.
